item.title: Democrats Buoyed by Abortion and Trump, Times/Siena Poll Finds
item.description: President Biden’s approval rating has climbed to 42 percent, and the number of Americans who believe the country is on the right track has doubled but remains low.
item.dc:creator: Lisa Lerer and Nate Cohn

item.title: Judge Names Special Master and Keeps Block on Mar-a-Lago Files Inquiry
item.description: The Justice Department is planning to appeal, but the decision is likely to significantly delay its investigation into former President Donald J. Trump’s handling of government records.
item.dc:creator: Charlie Savage, Alan Feuer and Glenn Thrush
item.media:credit: Emil Lippe for The New York Times
item.media:description: The special master will have the power to sift through more than 11,000 records the F.B.I. carted away from former President Donald J. Trump’s Florida estate.

item.title: TikTok’s CEO Navigates the Limits of His Power
item.description: Shou Zi Chew, TikTok’s chief executive, is balancing how to be an autonomous leader while juggling the demands of the app’s Chinese parent company.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Mac and Chang Che
item.media:credit: Philip Fong/Agence France-Presse — Getty Images
item.media:description: Shou Zi Chew, a longtime investor and former executive at Xiaomi, was appointed chief executive of TikTok in May 2021.

item.title: For Gen Z, TikTok Is the New Search Engine
item.description: Need to find a restaurant or figure out how to do something? Young people are turning to TikTok to search for answers. Google has noticed.
item.dc:creator: Kalley Huang

item.title: ‘I Ended Up on This Little Island’: Migrants Land in Political Drama
item.description: After long, perilous journeys, Venezuelans unexpectedly found themselves on Martha’s Vineyard, wondering what comes next.
item.dc:creator: Miriam Jordan and Remy Tumin
item.media:credit: Oliver Contreras for The New York Times
item.media:description: The Venezuelan migrants bused from Texas to Washington on Thursday arrived near Vice President Kamala Harris’s residence.

item.title: DeSantis and Abbott Intensify Fight Over Immigration
item.description: Decisions to bus migrants to the vice president’s residence and to fly others to Martha’s Vineyard were the latest attempts to provoke outrage over record arrivals at the border.
item.dc:creator: Will Sennott, Zolan Kanno-Youngs, Eileen Sullivan and Patricia Mazzei
item.media:credit: Matt Cosby for The New York Times
item.media:description: Migrants entered St. Andrew’s Episcopal Church in Edgartown, Mass., to meet with volunteers on Thursday, a day after being flown from Texas to Martha’s Vineyard.

item.title: At Old Coal Mines, the American Chestnut Tries for a Comeback
item.description: Across Appalachia, scientists and foresters are trying to reintroduce a hybrid version, helping to revive damaged land while also bringing back a beloved tree.
item.dc:creator: Elena Shao and Maddie McGarvey

item.title: Guantánamo Bay Prison Mission Is Stuck in a Cycle of Costly Delays
item.description: The mission has relied on short-term fixes for things like housing and medical care for two decades. With 36 detainees left, the prison will soon receive its 21st commander.
item.dc:creator: Carol Rosenberg
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
item.media:credit: Carol Rosenberg/The New York Times
item.media:description: Workers hammered plastic sheeting to the roofs of the new tiny houses at Guantánamo Bay after rains seeped inside, delaying the $10 million project until next year. In the background are older housing units, which had chronic mold problems.

item.title: In Central Asia’s ‘Great Game,’ China Seeks the Advantage
item.description: Xi Jinping’s visit to Central Asia this week sheds a light on his country’s efforts to increase its sway in the vast, resource-rich region once considered Russia’s domain.
item.dc:creator: Keith Bradsher
item.media:credit: Kazakhstan Presidential Press Office, via Agence France-Presse — Getty Images
item.media:description: Xi Jinping, China’s leader, arriving in Kazakhstan on Wednesday as part of his first trip outside China since the pandemic started.

item.title: ‘At the Breaking Point’: Tibetans, Under Lockdown, Make Rare Cries for Help
item.description: China’s ever-tightening Covid rules have prompted public complaints from residents of areas usually intimidated into keeping quiet.
item.dc:creator: Vivian Wang
item.media:credit: Visual China Group, via Getty Images
item.media:description: A socially distanced line, background, of people waiting for Covid tests in Lhasa, the capital of Tibet.

item.title: What’s a Back Kitchen and Why Has It Gotten so Popular?
item.description: The back kitchen, in essence a pantry on overdrive, has become increasingly popular in recent years, according to architects, designers and homebuilders.
item.dc:creator: Ronda Kaysen
item.media:credit: Clark Hodgin for The New York Times
item.media:description: Party guests enjoyed food and drinks in the main kitchen in the home of Michelle and Greg Barry in Rumson, N.J.

item.title: A Rail Strike Averted Reminds Us That There Is Power in a Union
item.description: The single best thing President Biden and the Democratic Party could do for workers is to give them the tools and support to build power for themselves.
item.dc:creator: Jamelle Bouie
item.media:credit: Bettmann/Getty Images
item.media:description: Illinois state troopers on the scene of a railroad strike.

item.title: How Far Should We Go to Save a Species?
item.description: As scientists push the frontiers of conservation technology, some of their initiatives raise ethical questions.
item.dc:creator: Tim McDonnell
item.media:credit: Javier Jaén

item.title: The World Now Has a Vision of Ukrainian Victory
item.description: After a successful counteroffensive, Ukrainians are cherishing a moment of happiness.
item.dc:creator: Nataliya Gumenyuk
item.media:credit: Evgeniy Maloletka/Associated Press
item.media:description: A mother and son in front of their house in Izium, Ukraine, on Wednesday.

item.title: Why Is There Still No Strategy to Defeat Donald Trump?
item.description: Trump-bashing makes us feel good; it doesn’t turn the tide.
item.dc:creator: David Brooks
item.media:credit: Mark Peterson for The New York Times

item.title: Now All Biden Has to Do Is Build It
item.description: Felicia Wong on the hard road ahead to make the president’s plans a lived reality.
item.dc:creator: ‘The Ezra Klein Show’
item.media:credit: The New York Times

item.title: Nuclear Power Still Doesn’t Make Much Sense
item.description: There’s a lot of new enthusiasm around nuclear power. It isn’t warranted.
item.dc:creator: Farhad Manjoo
item.media:credit: Michael Holahan/The Augusta Chronicle, via Associated Press
item.media:description: Plant Vogtle nuclear energy facility in Waynesboro, Ga.

item.title: Who’s Afraid of the Consumer Price Index?
item.description: There wasn’t really much news in that inflation report.
item.dc:creator: Paul Krugman
item.media:credit: Illustration by Sam Whitney/The New York Times; images by ilbusca and Kypros via Getty Images

item.title: Extreme Religious Liberty Is Undermining Public Health
item.description: Recent rulings are empowering the moral judgments of a small but politically powerful group.
item.dc:creator: Lindsay F. Wiley
item.media:credit: George Wylesol

item.title: Profiting in Congress
item.description: Dozens of lawmakers trade stocks related to their work, and it’s harming trust in the government.
item.dc:creator: German Lopez
item.media:credit: Tom Brenner for The New York Times
item.media:description: Members of Congress can buy and sell stocks with few restrictions.

item.title: The Promise and Pitfalls of Deep-Sea Mining
item.description: How a Canadian company and a regulator are balancing billions of dollars in profits against the future of the Pacific.
item.dc:creator: Natalie Kitroeff, Will Reid, Michael Simon Johnson, Rachelle Bonja, Liz O. Baylen, Lisa Chow, Dan Powell and Chris Wood
item.media:credit: Ashley Gilbertson for The New York Times
item.media:description: A polymetallic nodule. Mining companies describe the nodules as a “battery in a rock” because they contain the essential metals for a clean energy economy.

item.title: Vegetarian Recipes for Cozy Days
item.description: Soups, stews and comforting, feel-good foods for after a storm.
item.dc:creator: Tejal Rao
item.media:credit: David Malosh for The New York Times. Food Stylist: Simon Andrews.

item.title: Do You Know Someone Who Has Died of Covid Recently? We Want to Hear From You.
item.description: New York Times reporters are looking for people who will share the stories and experiences of loved ones who have recently died.
item.dc:creator: The New York Times
item.media:credit: Isadora Kosofsky for The New York Times
item.media:description: The Rose River Memorial in Los Angeles, created in 2021 by the artist Marcos Lutyens, honored lives taken by Covid.

item.title: 31 Bridges, 2 Cities, 6 Towns: Greenway Is New Jersey’s High Line
item.description: New Jersey plans to convert a defunct train line into a 9-mile park, connecting the state’s densest cities to some of its wealthiest suburbs.
item.dc:creator: Tracey Tully
item.media:credit: Bryan Anselm for The New York Times
item.media:description: A segment of the new, nine-mile linear state park will run through Newark.

item.title: Britain’s Spending and Tax Cut Plans Worry Investors in Its Debt
item.description: Simultaneous declines in bonds, stocks and the pound could set the stage for rising borrowing costs and persistent inflation.
item.dc:creator: Eshe Nelson
item.media:credit: Alice Zoo for The New York Times
item.media:description: London’s business district, where financial markets have been uneasy about Britain’s economic outlook.

item.title: Fred Franzia, 79, Dies; Upended Wine Industry With Two-Buck Chuck
item.description: An unorthodox businessman, he took on the wine industry and its high markups, selling wine at prices many families could afford every day.
item.dc:creator: Priya Krishna
item.media:credit: Eric Risberg/Associated Press
item.media:description: Fred Franzia in 2007 with a bottle of his inexpensive Charles Shaw wine. When asked how he could sell wine for less than a bottle of water, he replied, “They’re overcharging for the water — don’t you get it?”

item.title: How to Prepare for Flu Season
item.description: We may be more susceptible to the virus than we have been in recent years, but doctors have tips to stay healthy.
item.dc:creator: Melinda Wenner Moyer
item.media:credit: Guillem Casasús

item.title: How to Prevent Common Exercise Injuries
item.description: Here are the four exercises you’re most at risk of doing wrong — and what can keep you safe.
item.dc:creator: Rachel Fairbank

item.title: Gravel Biking is Getting Popular. Here’s How to Start.
item.description: A faster bicycle design with thicker tires is allowing cyclists to explore America’s 2.2 million miles of Here’s what you need to know about this new sport.
item.dc:creator: Hannah Singleton
item.media:credit: Alex Goodlett for The New York Times

item.title: How to Motivate Yourself to Exercise
item.description: Bundle your incentives. Be flexible. Get some support. Here’s how to get — and stay — motivated.
item.dc:creator: Christie Aschwanden
item.media:credit: Keith E. Morrison for The New York Times

item.title: A Full-Body Strength Training Workout at Home
item.description: If you’re willing to be creative, a set of elastic bands can be as effective as a gym full of weights.
item.dc:creator: Jenny Marder
item.media:credit: Cayce Clifford for The New York Times
item.media:description: In addition to resistance training, exercise bands can take the edge off of body weight exercises, like pull-ups. But trainers like Vanessa Liu warn against becoming too dependent on them.

item.title: Walking May Prevent New Knee Pain for Some, Study Suggests
item.description: Encouraging new research suggests walking could help prevent new bouts of knee pain in people with osteoarthritis.
item.dc:creator: Dani Blum
item.media:credit: Getty Images

item.title: The Eight Film Festival Movies That Got the Biggest Awards Boost
item.description: “Women Talking,” women fighting, a pair of Brendans and more: After Toronto, Venice and Telluride, here are the titles and performances in the conversation.
item.dc:creator: Kyle Buchanan
item.category: All the Beauty and the Bloodshed (Movie)
